review_blob: Nose is slightly winey, slight cherry notes. On the tongue, has a smooth rich feel without being heavy. Twinges of slight sourness in the beginning, but much less sour than expected. Minor bitterness towards the end. Being a lover of sour ales, this fell slightly short of my expectations.

When opened, was incredibly frothy, huge head when poured. Once settled, some of the carbonation had fallen out, but the overall taste was still delightful. Since a lot of the carbonation seemed to have disappeared in the head, the palate was a bit flat- taste did not suffer though. Nose is sweet with a bit of tang. Has a deeper, rich flavor which only truly comes out once the beer had left the tongue, which perhaps can be attributed to the wild yeast (an enhancing component). Overall very nice example of a belgian ale.

No cherry flavor. Has some tang of a natural cherry but nothing sweet. Has a slightly bitter finish. Does have a good palate - light and spritzy with a hint of sour. Overall disappointing. Would have liked more cherry flavor and depth to the beer.
